title: Tres Leches Cake
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350Â°F and grease a 9x13-inch baking pan with butter.
Mix together flour, baking powder, and salt in a medium bowl. Set aside.
In a stand mixer, beat eggs and sugar until light and fluffy. Add 2 teaspoons of vanilla.
On low speed, add flour mixture in parts, alternating with milk, until well combined.
Pour the batter into the pan and bake for 23-28 minutes until a tester comes out clean.
Let the cake cool for approximately 1 hour.
In a saucepan, whisk together cream, evaporated milk, and cinnamon. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 2 minutes.
Whisk in sweetened condensed milk and 1 teaspoon vanilla.
Poke holes in the cooled cake and pour the cream mixture over it.
Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Slice the cake, sprinkle with cinnamon, and serve with sliced strawberries, whipped cream, and mint leaves.
Store covered in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
